sources.title: THE VILLAIN STILL PURSUED HER (1940)
sources.description: Buster Keaton, Margret Hamilton, Billy Gilbert and Alan Mowbray star in this parody of melodrama.

sources.title: The Villain Still Pursued Her (1940) BUSTER KEATON
sources.description:
Stars: Buster Keaton, Anita Louise, Richard Cromwell
Director: Edward F. Cline

In this comedic send-up to classic stage melodramas, a villain by the name of Cribs has set his eyes on the beautiful Mary Wilson. To win her heart, he devises an ingenious, foil-proof plan to bring ruin to the reputation of our hero, Mary's husband, Edward! Watch for the prize scenes with Buster Keaton in the sizable role of the hero's best friend; Also stars Margaret Hamilton, the Wicked Witch from THE WIZARD OF OZ.

metadata.Plot: The widow Wilson and her daughter Mary have just learned that old Mr. Middleton, who held the mortgage on their home, has passed away. They are now visited by Middleton's lawyer, Cribbs, who informs them that Middleton's son and heir Edward plans to foreclose and take possession of their home. When Mary goes to plead with Edward, she soon discovers that it is really the unscrupulous Cribbs who wants to drive them out of their home. When Mary and Edward become engaged to be married, it looks as if all is well. But the calculating Cribbs has a new plan, which begins with luring young Edward into a lifestyle of drinking and dissipation.
metadata.Actors: Hugh Herbert, Anita Louise, Alan Mowbray
